review: I have a Roku 2 and the Fire TV Stick both attached to my TV. I find the Roku is still the preferred device for most of what I want to use it for. The biggest complaint I have about it is the fact that all screens are full of movies and shows that I don't want to watch. I mostly use Plex and occasionaly Prime TV and Movies.
author: G. Peterson

review: seriosly, best purchase I've made in a while. I used to stream all my videos from my laptop to my tv through an HDMI cable. It was nice, but still a hassle to start up and shut off. I saw that stupid commercial with Gary B. And thought, what kind of idiot would buy suck a thing. This idiot did, and I effing love it. The remote that comes with it is pretty slick, but not as slick as the touch smart free phone app remote, of which kicks mucho ass-ee-blay. I want to punt this little bastard out the window of a moving vehicle just so I can buy a mother one to relive the awesomeness of unboxing and setting up.
author: Gabriel Nunez

review: We've only been using this for about 3 weeks now, but can tell a huge difference with download speeds.  Netflix hasn't rebuffered the entire time we've used it.  We were using our blu-ray player for netflix for 4 years now and it rebuffers even though we have 15mb per second internet; it was worse during storms.  It's also nice that we can move it to the living room or bed room anytime we want without major setting up.
